verses.roman:
āśliṣya sama-śītoṣṇaṁ
prasūna-vana-mārutam
janās tāpaṁ jahur gopyo
na kṛṣṇa-hṛta-cetasaḥ

synonyms: āśliṣya—embracing; sama—equal; prasūna-vana—of the forest of flowers; mārutam—the wind; janāḥ—the people in general; tāpam—suffering; jahuḥ—were able to abandon; gopyaḥ—the gopīs; kṛṣṇa—by Lord Kṛṣṇa; hṛta—stolen; cetasaḥ—whose hearts.
translation: Except for the gopīs, whose hearts had been stolen by Kṛṣṇa, the people could forget their suffering by embracing the wind coming from the flower-filled forest. This wind was neither hot nor cold.
